segment.source: Using Application Virtualization Servers as a Package Management Solution
segment.target: Using Application Virtualization Servers as a Package Management Solution

segment.source: Using Application Virtualization Servers as a Package Management Solution
segment.target: Using Application Virtualization Servers as a Package Management Solution

segment.source: Using Application Virtualization Servers as a Package Management Solution
segment.target: Using Application Virtualization Servers as a Package Management Solution

segment.source: If you do not have an existing ESD system to deploy your Application Virtualization solution or do not wish to use one, you will need to install one or more Application Virtualization Management Servers as the core of your system architecture.
segment.target: If you do not have an existing ESD system to deploy your Application Virtualization solution or do not wish to use one, you will need to install one or more Application Virtualization Management Servers as the core of your system architecture.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization Management Server requires a dedicated server computer and needs a Microsoft SQL Server database.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization Management Server requires a dedicated server computer and needs a Microsoft SQL Server database.

segment.source: The database can be on the same server, or it can be configured on a corporate database server that is accessible to the Application Virtualization Management Server over a high-speed LAN connection.
segment.target: The database can be on the same server, or it can be configured on a corporate database server that is accessible to the Application Virtualization Management Server over a high-speed LAN connection.

segment.source: In addition, you will need to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Console, on either the Application Virtualization Management Server or on a designated management workstation, and you will need to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Web Service, which can also be installed on the Application Virtualization Management Server or on a separate IIS server.
segment.target: In addition, you will need to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Console, on either the Application Virtualization Management Server or on a designated management workstation, and you will need to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management Web Service, which can also be installed on the Application Virtualization Management Server or on a separate IIS server.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization Management Console is used to connect to the Application Virtualization Management Web Service, enabling the system administrator to interact with the Application Virtualization Management Server.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization Management Console is used to connect to the Application Virtualization Management Web Service, enabling the system administrator to interact with the Application Virtualization Management Server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Access to the applications is controlled by means of Security Groups in Active Directory Domain Services, so you will need to plan a process to set up a security group for each virtualized application and for managing which users are added to each group.
segment.target: Access to the applications is controlled by means of Security Groups in Active Directory Domain Services, so you will need to plan a process to set up a security group for each virtualized application and for managing which users are added to each group.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization Management Server administrator configures the server to use these Active Directory groups, and the server then automatically controls access to the packages based on Active Directory group membership.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization Management Server administrator configures the server to use these Active Directory groups, and the server then automatically controls access to the packages based on Active Directory group membership.

segment.target: Planning Your Streaming Solution in an Application Virtualization Server-Based Implementation

segment.target: Describes available options for using Application Virtualization Streaming Servers in conjunction with your Application Virtualization Management Server-based implementation.
